item.title: Fast Sum of Two Squares Algorithm
item.description: In this post I show how writing primes as the sum of two squares is related to factoring Gaussian integers. I then describe an algorithm to compute the sum of two squares representation. Gaussian Integers I have a special penchant for Gaussian integers because they are the first ring I learned about (besides the regular integers of course). Mathematically, they are the set of complex numbers $a+bi$ with $a,b$ integers, and they are denoted as $\mathbb{Z}[i]$.
